page.title: 10Tourist Attractions
page.content: The development of Rutland Water as a recreational centre for trout fishing, water sports and nature walks has greatly increased the tourist traffic through the Welland Valley, a natural scenic route. There are four registered Bed and Breakfast houses in the area and Medbourne Village Hall Committee provide home-made teas every Sunday throughout the summer. The revenue from the teas is used for the upkeep of the hall. During the autumn and winter the Fernie Hunt attracts a large number of car followers. On Easter Monday each year, the village numbers are swelled by visitors who participate in or watch the Bottle Kicking ceremony which is preceeded in Medbourne by a band parade.
